moves.1. e4 e6: I always thought white had the advantage at this opening because my c8 bishop is blocked by e6 pawn.
moves.2. d4: AND white has control of the center.
moves.2... d5: guess I have to take my own share of it (center)
moves.3. Nc3 Bb4: In case of exd5, my pawn would be alone with no pawn protecting it=> weak position
moves.4. Bd2 dxe4:
prevents previous position
uncovers queen to attack d4 pawn
moves.6. Qxg7 Rg8:
unpleasant position for black's queen
takes control of semi-open file
moves.7. Qh6 Nc6 8. O-O-O Rg6 9. Qh4 Rg4 10. Q: move the queen around even if bishop loses any activity in the center
moves.11. Qh3 Nxd4: natural take pawn and move knight to a dangerous position because of its extensive grasp on its surroundings
moves.12. Nb5: seems wrong, Be3 is better, I think (pins knight to queen with rook)
moves.12... e5 13. Qc3 c6 14. h3: simply delays the inevitable: great gain of tempo.
moves.14... Rg6 15. Na3 Nd5: another pawn in the center and I get a "free" move
moves.18... c5: queen can't run to c4 anymore because of pawn
moves.19... a6:
Anything black does will end up with a lost queen.

0-1

this opening does have its advantages
